definitions: a person who maintains something in its original or existing state or condition

examples.text: the Benedictines have been best known as educators and as preservers of antique texts
they are the trusted preservers of law and order and they deserve our respect

shortDefinitions: person who maintains something in its original state

definitions: a substance used to preserve food, wood, or other materials against damage or decay

examples.text: you might also want to coat the bottom of the canes with wood preserver

shortDefinitions: substance used to preserve materials against decay
